sentences.en: Athena used the disguise of Mentor to advise and stand beside her beloved Odysseus.
sentences.cn: 阿西娜采用曼托的伪装建议并且站在她心爱的奥德赛旁边.

sentences.en: But this was just the beginning of Odysseus'adventures.
sentences.cn: 但是这只是奥迪赛一连串冒险的开端.

sentences.en: Crice metamorphosed the companions of Odysseus into swine.
sentences.cn: 塞西把奥德赛的几个同伴都变成了猪.

sentences.en: Here, exercising great patience and self - control, Odysseus tests the loyalty of his servants.
sentences.cn: 这时, 奥德修斯练就了巨大的忍耐力和 自我 控制力, 检验他的仆人们是否忠心.

sentences.en: In order to steal it out, Odysseus and Diomedes slipped into the capital one night in  disguise , known to none but Hellen.
sentences.cn: 为了将神像偷出城, 一天夜里奥德修斯和狄俄墨德斯乔装改扮潜入首都, 这一切只有海伦知道。

sentences.en: Like Odysseus, we felt at some special moment that we were home.
sentences.cn: 就好像奥德赛一样, 我们在一些特别的片刻感到我们回到了家.

sentences.en: Mr Jones: " Like Odysseus, he looked wiser when seated. "
sentences.cn: 琼斯先生: “ 象奥迪塞一样, 他坐着的时候看起来更聪明. ”

sentences.en: Odysseus and his men stole it.
sentences.cn: 奥迪赛和他的手下把它给偷了.

sentences.en: Odysseus is the archetype of the wanderer.
sentences.cn: 奥地修斯是长途漫游者的原型.

sentences.en: Odysseus saw this. He and his companions took the biggest sheep.
sentences.cn: 奥迪赛看到了这个情形, 他和他的同伴就抓了那些最大只的羊.

sentences.en: Odysseus wanted to explore the island.
sentences.cn: 奥迪赛想要查看这座岛.

sentences.en: Odysseus was a legendary Greek hero.
sentences.cn: 奥狄修斯是传说中的希腊英雄.

sentences.en: Odysseus's heroic exploits are celebrated in ` The Odyssey '.
sentences.cn: 《奥德赛》史诗中歌颂了奥德修斯的丰功伟绩.

sentences.en: Odyssey relates the misfortunes of Odysseus after the Trojan War.
sentences.cn: 《奥德赛》叙述特洛伊战争后奥德修斯经历的种种厄运.

sentences.en: Sir , we are Greeks returning from the Trojan War, answered Odysseus.
sentences.cn: 奥迪赛回答:“阁下, 我们是从特洛伊战争回来的希腊人. ”

sentences.en: The Sirens that nearly seduced Odysseus into crashing his ship comes to his mind.
sentences.cn: 他的脑海中浮现出奥德修斯在海上听到海妖歌声的场景.

sentences.en: There he helped Odysseus when the hero came to him for advice.
sentences.cn: 在那儿，当奥德修斯前去征求他的意见时，泰瑞西斯帮助了他。

trans.tran_cn: 奥德修斯（古希腊荷马所作史诗<奥德赛>中的主人公，伊塞卡国王，在特洛伊战中献木马计）

trans.tran_en: one of the foremost of the Greek heroes at the siege of Troy, noted for his courage and ingenuity
